section.name: Release notes
section.p: This version of the community has the following changes from version 2006.2.

subsection.name: Password-changing facility
subsection.p: Users may now change their own passwords; previously, only the community administrators could change passwords.

The password-changing facility is a page within the community web-application, linked from the menu on the community's front page. Passwords may not be changed from the AstroGrid workbenmch via the web service.

subsection.name: Passwords must be at least six characters long
subsection.p: Starting with this release, all user passwords must be at least six characters long. This restriction is introduced for compatibility with MyProxy.

subsection.name: Experimental certificate authority and MyProxy linkage
subsection.p: The community may now operate a certificate authority and use a MyProxy installation if appropriate software is installed on the community host. Certificates may be issued for community members and installed in MyProxy.

To use the certificate authority, OpenSSL and MyProxy must be installed on the machine running the community web-application. The authority itself must be manually installed in three files (private key, root certificate and serial-number record).
There are some extra environment entries in the configuration that configure the certificate authority. These locate the files and directory noted above.

This feature is currently experimental and should not be used in production communities. Service providers should not, at this stage, trust identities certified by this community software to be secure against misuse. The certificate authority should be made ready for production use in the next version of this component.

If you want to experiment with the certificate authority, please contact Guy Rixon (gtr@ast.cam.ac.uk) To run a community without a certificate authority, simply do not install MyProxy and the certificate-authority files.

subsection.name: Web-page menus rearranged
subsection.p: The menus in pages of the community web application have been rearranged. All the features useful in a production community are now available in the menu on the front page of the community. There are many other administration commands, all to do with features not yet used in real communities, and these are grouped on their own page.
The "health" indicator for the commnity database is now shown in the title bar of the administration pages.
